Winter Weather in Minneapolis

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” width=”70%” custom_padding=”2px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|300|||||||” text_font_size=”16px” text_line_height=”1.9em” text_orientation=”center” global_colors_info=”{}”]

If there’s one thing Minnesotans can all agree on, winters here are tough. In fact, Minnesota is ranked as the third coldest state and one that has the harshest winters in the country. Averaging between 36 to 70 inches of snowfall each year, every Minneapolis resident knows it’s important to hire a snow-plowing professional to help deal with and brave through feet of snow.

Winter weather can pose challenges when it comes to getting around, whether you’re trying to get out of your driveway to head to work or have visitors coming. For most people, the effort to clear snow and ice on your own isn’t worth it. Minneapolis snow plowing is not for the faint of heart.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”3_5,2_5″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”45px|auto||auto||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”3_5″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”titleGreen” _builder_version=”4.18.1″ _module_preset=”default” header_font=”|700|||||||” header_font_size=”50px” header_2_font=”|700|||||||” header_2_text_align=”left” header_2_text_color=”#000000″ header_2_font_size=”50px” custom_margin=”||28px|||” header_2_text_align_tablet=”center” header_2_text_align_phone=”center” header_2_text_align_last_edited=”on|phone” header_2_font_size_tablet=”50px” header_2_font_size_phone=”40px” header_2_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” locked=”off” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Why You Shouldn’t Handle Snow Plowing All By Yourself

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.18.1″ _module_preset=”default” header_3_font=”|700|||||||” header_3_text_color=”#068fd7″ header_3_font_size=”20px” custom_margin=”||4px|||” locked=”off” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Injury Risks

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.18.1″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|300|||||||” text_font_size=”16px” text_line_height=”1.9em” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Believe it or not, each year, 100 people die from shoveling snow. Most of these deaths are from heart attacks and cardiovascular problems. In addition, 11,500 individuals are poorly injured enough from shoveling snow. The most common injuries are soft tissue injuries, lacerations, fractures, and heart-related injuries. They are usually caused by overexertion, followed by slips or falls and getting hit with a snow shovel. The more snow accumulation there is, the greater the chance of sustaining an injury while shoveling.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.18.1″ _module_preset=”default” header_3_font=”|700|||||||” header_3_text_color=”#068fd7″ header_3_font_size=”20px” custom_margin=”||4px|||” locked=”off” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Operations

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.18.1″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|300|||||||” text_font_size=”16px” text_line_height=”1.9em” global_colors_info=”{}”]

And not just shoveling, do you or anyone in your business or home really know how to operate a snow plow? There are strategies for driving in snow and ice, knowing how to avoid scraping the sidewalk and other obstacles which could damage or tarnish the aesthetic of your property, and knowing how and where to place the plowed snow. Better to delegate that to professionals.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.18.1″ _module_preset=”default” header_3_font=”|700|||||||” header_3_text_color=”#068fd7″ header_3_font_size=”20px” custom_margin=”||4px|||” locked=”off” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Save Time and Money

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.18.1″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|300|||||||” text_font_size=”16px” text_line_height=”1.9em” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Employing the help of a Minneapolis snow plowing professional means you’re not only saving yourself from the possibility of an injury resulting from a slip and fall but also gaining time— time you would’ve otherwise spent shoveling parking lots. In addition, you’ll have the peace of mind that comes with knowing the job will be done well. You won’t have to wake up early to shovel or worry that someone could get hurt. Even if you have a snowblower, removing snow as quickly or effectively as professionals with plowing trucks is impossible.

Everyone will notice how quickly your snow disappears and how nice your place looks without it.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.18.1″ _module_preset=”default” header_3_font=”|700|||||||” header_3_text_color=”#068fd7″ header_3_font_size=”20px” custom_margin=”||4px|||” locked=”off” global_colors_info=”{}”]
